text: {| |} The Kamov Ka-18 (NATO reporting name Hog) was a Soviet four-seat utility helicopter that first flew in 1955. It was a development of the Kamov Ka-15, with a lengthened fuselage and a more powerful engine - the 255 hp Ivchenko AI-14V radial. Total production from Kamov was about 120 units. ==Operators== ; *Soviet Naval Aviation ==Specifications (Ka-18)== ==See also== ==References== * Stroud, John. Soviet Transport Aircraft since 1945. London: Putnam, 1968. . ==External links== * https://web.archive.org/web/20080322060201/http://www.aviation.ru/Ka/#18 Category:Kamov aircraft Category:1950s Soviet civil utility aircraft Kamov Ka-018 Category:Coaxial rotor helicopters Category:Single-engined piston helicopters Category:Aircraft first flown in 1955
title: Kamov Ka-18
